intro: Lampranthus schlechteri, commonly known as the Orange Sunset, is a striking succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often colorful flora. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid conditions. Its flowers are typically orange or red, adding a vibrant splash of color to its environment. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
